Belgium:
Partial legislative elections of 1874
Prime Minister Barthélémy de Theux de Meylandt dies in office; succeeded by Jules Malou
Chile: Another treaty of limits is signed with Bolivia due to political tensions.
Colombia: Santiago Pérez de Manosalbas is President of the United States of Colombia
Haiti:
Saget relinquishes the Presidency; the Constituent Assembly elects Michel Domingue as President
President Domingue promulgates the Constitution of 1874
Philippine: Manuel Blanco Valderrama appointed acting Governor-General (1874)
José Malcampo y Monje appointed Governor-General (1874–1877)
Spain: Spain under the Restoration: The period began. The First Spanish Republic was disestablished.
Switzerland: The constitution was revised to establish free public education and the optional referendum, and to make it easier for Swiss citizens to move between cantons.
Taiwan: Japanese invasion of Taiwan (1874): Japan sends a punitive expedition to Taiwan in retribution for the Mudan Incident and forces the Qing dynasty to pay indemnities Shen Baozhen has three roads constructed linking eastern and western Taiwan
